content: Back in business: Household services can reopen May 19 | MuskokaRegion.com Back in business: Household services can reopen May 19 News May 15, 2020 by Sarah Law MuskokaRegion.com Indoor and outdoor household services that can follow public health guidelines have been permitted to reopen starting Tuesday, May 19. This means private households can hire workers on or about the premises, including housekeepers, cooks, personal affairs management, nanny services, babysitters and other domestic personnel. They can also hire cleaning and maintenance services, such as indoor and outdoor painting, window cleaning, pool cleaning and general repairs. Here are some tips from Ontario's Workplace Safety and Prevention Services on how to keep staff safe as they return to work: • Use the correct concentration and type of cleaning agents when cleaning and disinfecting surfaces. • Increase airflow by opening windows and doors to reduce contaminant buildup. • Consider job rotation to help avoid people doing tasks in the same place at the same time. • Do not shake dirty laundry, and wash items in the warmest water possible. • Increase cleaning frequency on commonly touched surfaces. • Make sure workers clean their hands using soap and water or alcohol-based hand sanitizer between cleaning rooms, spaces and dealing with customers.
